intro: Coccoloba pubescens, commonly known as the hairy glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The flowers are usually bright yellow or red, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
